We explore the influence of boundary conditions altering the function \\(u\\) through an integral transformation \\(T[u] = \\int_D k(x,y) u(y) dy \\), where \\(k(x, y)\\) is a kernel modifying \\(u\\) along the boundary \\(D\\).

If \\(T[u]\\) is applied to modify the boundary conditions at time \\(t = 0\\) and then \\(u\\) evolves according to \\(\\nabla^2 u = 0\\) without further intervention, will \\(u(x, t)\\) at time \\(t = T\\) be the same if no transformation was applied initially?
Explanation: The integral transformation \\(T[u]\\) modifies the initial boundary conditions, which affect the solutions of the Laplace equation. Since the Laplace equation is sensitive to boundary changes, the evolution of \\(u\\) will diverge from that of an unmodified condition.
